ovdesc.p: The PAYMENT RULES Property Class is used by any products which have amounts billed and made due from the customer.

An arrangement may have several bills outstanding and each bill may be comprised of multiple amounts (e.g. principal, principal interest, penalty, tax, charges, etc.). When a customer makes a payment, the entire due amount may not be satisfied. The PAYMENT RULES Property Class is used to define the method by which a single payment will be applied to multiple bills and multiple amount types.

In the case where billed amounts exist but the due date has not yet been reached, users can determine that the billed amounts can be made due up to the amount of any remaining payment. This allows for the processing of bill payments which are received prior to the due date.
It can accept either YES or NO.
Ex:
Repayrule 1:
Application Order – Oldest Last
Application Type – Bill Date
Sequence – 1, 2
Property – Loaninterest, Loanaccount.
Make Bill Due – Yes
Remainder Activity - LENDING-APPLYPAYMENT-REPAYRULE2
Repayrule 2:
Application Order – Oldest Last
Application Type – Bill Date
Sequence – 1, 2
Property – Prinincreasecharge, Disbursecharge
Remainder Activity – LENDING-APPLYPAYMENT-CURRENT
Bill Details
Bill 1 – Scheduled Bill
Bill Amount - 10000
Issue Date = 10 Jan 2008
Due Date = 10 Jan 2008
Bill 2 – Activity Charge bill raised because of Principal Increase
Bill Amount - 1000
Issue Date = 1 Jan 2008
Due Date = 20 Jan 2008
Bill 3 – Activity Charge bill raised because of Disbursement
Bill Amount - 1500
Issue Date – 5 Jan 2008
Due Date – 20 Jan 2008
Repayment Amount – 12500
Repayment Date – 15 Jan 2008
Order of settling
Repayrule1 will settle 10000 for Bill1 and will DUE the activity charge bills so that repayrule2 can settle bills related to activity charges

This field denotes how the repaid amount should be applied to produce the future scheduled bills in advance. This field will hold either one of the 2 values PARTIAL,FULL and they are mandatory for the ADVANCE Payment rule type.
Example
On 28th Dec, a repayment is made for $900 which can settle 2 future CONSTANT schedules each of $500 on 02-Jan fully & 07-Jan partially
If the repayment is 100 against the current interest if accrued (ACCLOANINTEREST) & the rest 800 could be allocated against the principal (CURPRINCIPAL).

FULL - Denotes the payment rules is applicable only if the amount can fully settle future scheduled bills. System will raise "SETTLED" bills for these future schedules with full repayment date as the financial date

System will raise bills only if the repayment settles the entire bill amount. In this case, system will generate and settle bill for 02-Jan while remaining $400 will be processed by its remainder activity.

02 Jan - Bill 1 - $500 will be OR.TOTAL.AMOUNT and OS.TOTAL.AMOUNT will be 0 and the Bill date, payment date will be 02 Jan and the financial date will be 28th Dec, Bill statuses are Advanced, Settled

PARTIAL - Denotes the repaid amount is eligible to settle future scheduled bills even if it settles only partial amount. System will raise an "ADVANCED" bill for this schedule with original financial date as the financial date
Example - PARTIAL
For the same example provided above, system will raise a bill in addition to '02 Jan' Bill, as the amount could also settle a future schedule in partial

07 Jan - Bill 2 - $400 will be allocated fully towards the ACCOUNT, and INTEREST portion will be 0 . In Bill the OR.TOTAL.AMOUNT will be 500, with financial date as 07th Jan and then system will update the Bill status as Advanced.
07 Jan - Bill 2 - The remaining $100 will be made due on its original payment date against the principal amount and update the bill status as "DUE"
This field is reserved for future use

This field represents the balance to be paid for the defined property. The values allowed at present are CURRENT and NULL. If PROP.APPL.TYPE is null, the due balance in the bill for the property is settled according to the type defined in the field Application.Type.
If PROP.APPL.TYPE is current, the current balance of the property is settled. (e.g. current principal, accrued interest, etc).
This field allows us to settle current balance along with the due balances.
If the field APPLICATION.TYPE has a value CURRENT, value in the field PROP.APPL.TYPE should also be CURRENT for all the properties defined.
This field forms a associated multivalue set with property and sequence
This field along with sequence can be used to specify the sequence in which the balances can be settled
When a payment is made which satisfies all of the due and overdue amounts and there is a remainder of funds (i.e. an overpayment), then this field can be used to handle remainder of funds.

This is handled by specifying the Activity to be processed for the remainder of the payment. This will be subject to any Transaction Rules. Should the transaction fail, the remainder amount will be processed by the Default Activity specified in Accounting.
Ex 1:
Bill Due Amount – 10000
Remainder Activity – LENDING-APPLYPAYMENT-CURRENT
Repayment Amount – 15000
Settlement Method
Bill due amount will be settled with 10000 and the remaining 5000 will be used for settling current balances
This field is used to specify the property sequence in which the balances will be affected during repayment. This field is associated with PROPERTY field.

This attribute is related to advance payment and a value “YES” denotes that we can pay more than the accrued interest as well. This is currently applicable only for Fixed Interest Method where the total profit amount for the contract is known. And the system will ensure that accrual happens for the profit amount during the life of the contract for Fixed Interest method. The reason why this is disabled for conventional type of Interest is that there is a probability that the source balance can become 0 enabling a mismatch between the accrual and collected interest amount.
Validation:
• Applicable for Fixed Interest Method
• Applicable for ADVANCE type of payments

For billed amounts, in addition to specifying whether Properties or Dates will be given priority, the user must decide in which order multiple bills will be processed. This field can be used to specify the order in which multiple bills has to be procesed.
This field can accept
1. Oldest First - Order of processing will start from first bill.
2. Oldest Last - Order of processing will start from last bill.
If APPLICATION.TYPE is CURRENT then input is not allowed in this field.
This field is used to specify how the payment rules will apply to an arrangement.
This can have any of the below three values.

Current: Payment will be applied on arrangement's current balances. (e.g. current principal, accrued interest, etc.). This will settle the current balances and doesn’t look at application order. Input to application order will not be allowed for Current Balance repayments.
Bill Property: For product with bills and due amounts, payment to the due amounts will be Property wise(e.g. all Principal amounts followed by all Interest amounts, etc.)
Bill Date: For product with bills and due amounts, payment to the due amounts will be bill date wise (e.g., all amount on bill 1 followed by all amounts of bill 2, etc.).
